content.raw:
When the hand is still, the IMU readings do not read 0 (which is what I would expect).

You can test this by setting all the joint commands to 0 in the hx_requester or hx_controller example of haptix_comm. The example will print out linear acceleration and angular velocity according to the IMUs, They fluctuate with an error of +-0.1 with values like:

		# 0
			Linear acceleration: (-0.103962, 3.311932, 8.806124)
			Angular velocity: (-0.254583, 0.005861, -0.008637)
		# 1
			Linear acceleration: (0.390772, 4.283046, 8.846578)
			Angular velocity: (-0.337006, 0.026943, -0.004305)
		# 2
			Linear acceleration: (-0.048678, 3.512606, 8.986201)
			Angular velocity: (-0.192542, -0.005319, 0.007913)
		# 3
			Linear acceleration: (0.151096, 3.627749, 8.981415)
			Angular velocity: (-0.246110, 0.006648, 0.000415)
		# 4
			Linear acceleration: (0.530170, 5.016282, 10.218425)
			Angular velocity: (-0.669509, -0.347165, -0.237803)
content.html:
When the hand is still, the IMU readings do not read 0 (which is what I would expect).

You can test this by setting all the joint commands to 0 in the hx_requester or hx_controller example of haptix_comm. The example will print out linear acceleration and angular velocity according to the IMUs, They fluctuate with an error of +-0.1 with values like:

    # 0
        Linear acceleration: (-0.103962, 3.311932, 8.806124)
        Angular velocity: (-0.254583, 0.005861, -0.008637)
    # 1
        Linear acceleration: (0.390772, 4.283046, 8.846578)
        Angular velocity: (-0.337006, 0.026943, -0.004305)
    # 2
        Linear acceleration: (-0.048678, 3.512606, 8.986201)
        Angular velocity: (-0.192542, -0.005319, 0.007913)
    # 3
        Linear acceleration: (0.151096, 3.627749, 8.981415)
        Angular velocity: (-0.246110, 0.006648, 0.000415)
    # 4
        Linear acceleration: (0.530170, 5.016282, 10.218425)
        Angular velocity: (-0.669509, -0.347165, -0.237803)
